text: [Music]
hey guys angel here in today's video I'm
gonna share with you a recipe that my
grandmother taught me on how to make an
Asian broccoli stem salad now she
actually taught me this recipe a long
long time ago when I was helping her
prepare broccoli I would basically cut
the tops off the broccoli and I used to
just toss the stems and she told me that
of course not wanting to waste food that
the stems are the best part of the
broccoli and that we could make an Asian
broccoli stem salad and it has since
then been one of my favorite ways to use
the broccoli stems it's super good it's
healthy and it makes a really great cold
appetizer so with that let's get started
for this recipe we will need 1 clove of
fresh garlic now fair warning it is kind
of garlicky so if you're afraid of raw
garlic or you just don't like garlic
breath it's totally ok to omit this but
for today I'm going to use it because I
love fresh garlic in addition we will
need some broccoli now we want broccoli
with these stems on and you can usually
find broccoli with the stems on in the
organic veggie section next we will need
some cane sugar some salt and finally
some Asian sesame oil now let's wrap our
broccoli to start we'll first chop and
separate LeBrock Lee from the stems I'm
going to save my broccoli florets for
another dish while just focusing on the
stems for now once you have your stems
trim off the ends and sides as needed
with a knife then I'm going to use a
vegetable peeler to help remove the last
outer layer of the broccoli skin when
you're done you'll be left with just the
light green stems give them a quick
rinse and then cut them into bite-size
pieces like this
next transfer the pieces to a small bowl
and prepare one clove of fresh garlic
[Music]
then add half a teaspoon of salt the
clove of minced garlic and stir and mix
everything really well and let it
marinate for 30 minutes after 30 minutes
you'll notice that there's excess liquid
in the bowl discard the liquid and give
the broccoli stems a light rinse with
water before draining again this will
help remove any extra saltiness now
we'll add a quarter teaspoon of cane
sugar plus a drizzle or two a sesame oil
to taste and finally mix everything
really well and refrigerate to serve as
a cold appetizer or snack
[Music]
so that's how you make my grandma's
Asian broccoli stem salad it is really
really good I can already smell the
garlic from here mmm
garlic and the sesame oil and I am gonna
show you how crunchy this is so I like
putting mine in the fridge overnight
because I feel like it makes it more
crunchy and crisp and it is just super
delicious mmm that was so good it's a
little bit garlicky but I like it I hope
you guys liked this appetizer recipe
give me a thumbs up if you did and if
you like this video and you want to see
more videos like this including a
Taiwanese dessert recipe that I have
coming up soon don't forget to subscribe
to my youtube channel so you never miss
the video and tell them take care and I
will see you guys in the next one
bye for now
[Music]
you
[Music]
